definitions.definition: A process by which anything disintegrates .
The condition of anything which has disintegrated .
The wearing away or falling to pieces of rocks or strata , produced by atmospheric action, frost , ice , etc.

subdefinitions.definition: The radioactive decay of a single atom .
examples: The sample exhibited an activity of three disintegrations per second.

main_definition: A process by which anything disintegrates .
secondary_definitions: The condition of anything which has disintegrated .
( geology ) The wearing away or falling to pieces of rocks or strata , produced by atmospheric action, frost , ice , etc.
( nuclear physics ) The process of radioactive decay .
